reviews.review_msg: Great prof. Energetic and interesting, great speaker. Always willing to meet outside of class, even on weekends, for extra help. The workload seems daunting at first, but it's spread out over the course. Reading the textbooks are a MUST!!!

Neven was willing to meet us at Carleton, at Ottawa U, in Montreal, on the bus and in the pub (don't know if anyone ever took him up on that one)This class literally taught me more about the world (i.e. ask for Spam and potatoes in Nepal)than any other class I have ever taken or likely will take.

AWESOME teacher. incredibly fun lectures with relevant material and stories provided to support his arguments. a veritable treasure trove of cool information. however - he will challenge you to think outside the box with your essays. Well worth it to take the class. by far the best teacher i have had at carleton. (i'm in year 4). take the class.

Neven was honestly the best prof I have encountered so far. His lectures were sooo entertaining; I looked forward to going to class every lecture.  His assignments are challenging, but you learn a lot while doing them. I switched into a double major with History after his class. I really hope to take more of his classes in my degree.

Neven in definitely one of my favourite professors at Carleton. He takes the train all the way into ottawa on a sunday afternoon just to give us help on his diabolically hard essays. Great teacher and he has awesome anecdotal little stories about his life that make coming to class a pleasure. thanksthis class would have sucked hard wihtout you

Really facinating teacher. Absolutly hilarious. You had to go to class a listen because he didn't have slides online, but that wasn't an issue because the classes were so fun to listen too. Definitly would take one of his classes again

Neven is an amazing professor.  He is very entertaining and brings the subject to life.  His lectures are always interesting.  The course itself can be very difficult at times, but Neven tries to help his students as much as possible.  Overall, great prof!
Favourite prof ever. Super helpful and available for assignments, hilarious classes, challenges us without making us want to die.

What I like about Neven is his teaching style. He presents the material as no textbook would, from a weird perspective - yet he backs it up brilliantly. The Google Earth is great tool to effortlessly absorb geography. Neven seems to truly care about his career and students. I took some notes for my future teaching career from him ; )
Really good prof, cared a lot about his lectures, and was always willing to help out. Marks pretty hard, but allows you chance to make it up. would reccommend his course to anyone.
One of my favorite professors so far. His classes were very interesting, and his intelligence shows. Expects a lot from his students, but you end up learning more from that.
Amazing!!! love this class because of the professor.

Neven was a great teacher, and the course was really easy to follow. The best part was the fact that if you really needed help he was acutally willing to go out of his way and help you learn, Id tell anyone i know to take a course with Neven. A+ prof

Really great professor. Definitely knows what he is doing and makes assignments simple and clear. Expects a lot from students but is more than available to help and there is no excuse for getting a bad mark because he will baby you every step. I would take a class if he was teaching even if I wasn't completely interested in the subject.
great guy, awesome professor, knows what hes talking about, and makes his exams and assignments very straight forward

While he said my writing was quite good, he still gave me a poor mark on one essy.  That aside, he taught in a very engaging manner (...what he taught was pure crap), always made himself available, funny (not as funny as he thinks he is), and his exam is exactly as he described it.  The only bad thing, incomprehensible marking scheme.

Neven was a great professor. His lectures are really understandable because he uses Google Earth to show us exactly where the locations are. His tutorials were the best. The only thing that I didn't really like was that he expected too much from our essays. Other than that, neven is a great professor.

An excellent instructor. Extremely clear, makes the class highly interesting by giving a lot of background to his discussions and is very witty. Encourages true learning by setting a decent standard for our essays. Teachers don't come as good as this anymore.

Friendly, Funny, and Fine! :)Oh and he's a great teacher as well! Not only is he amazing at explaining the material but he is more than willing to help you after hours if you just aren't getting it! Watch out for...the essays and some pretty dry primary source analysis! Other than what his class is awesome!

I loved this class! Especially the tutorials. Neven is such an amazing teacher and I would definitely take another class with him. Not only was he interesting but so gorgeous too. Definitely the hottest professor I've had so far. One flaw he had though was that he expected way too much from the essays and didn't give enough instruction beforehand.

Neven has the rare ability to take a difficult subject and clarify it for anyone who's willing to put in the time and effort.  He's professional, but not cold.  He's friendly, but doesn't sacrifice professionalism.  He teaches in a concise and engaging style that probes and captures the interest of the class, and holds it until the final tutorial.
English is not my first language and this is my first University course in BC. Nevin helped me to get confidence and surpass myself

Overall, good professor. He's a natural teacher- able to simplify complicated issues, interested in the topic, and a careful and devoted grader. He was helpful and quite available. I enjoyed his class.
No Comments

He's hot, and smart and funny, but his teaching style is not very good. He wasn't very clear, especially with the essays and I'm pretty sure he screwed a bunch of people over on the final exam. His marking/grading didn't make any sense to me.

Neven was an incredible prof. He's clear, interesting, witty, engaging, and entirely devoted to helping his students succeed. While his lectures weren't always required, they were always filled because he made his subject interesting. As a first year student, I think that Neven has prepared me for the remainder of my post secondary.

Neven was one of the most interesting profs I have had so far in my post-secondary career. He is probably one of the few that would encourage students to go find him for help on essays, assignments and readings. Overall, his lectures were informative and his assignments did help the class improve. He is an awesome prof =)

Neven was incredible!! I couldn't believe how smart, funny and helpful he was.  He's very clear with what he expects...so as long as you follow his guidelines you'll do great in the class.  I learned a ton and would highly recommend his class.
good teacher overall

Neven is an awsome prof.  He is always willing to help and he is very very funny.   He's very helpful, and because of his help my writing improved greatly.  His lectures are very interesting.  I would recommend that anyone who has a chance to take Neven's class should.  Again very interesting class because of the prof!!

The course content was so interesting,and the proffesor gave a really interesting history behind all texts and highlighted important themes.He was very useful, and ALWAYS available to help students! Lectures were interesting, comical, clear, informative and consistent. He was by far my favorite prof. We studied voltaire,more,plato,smith and kafka!!
Neven made the subject shine! He was informative, insightful, and always willing to help. The classes were a lot of fun, owing much to his engaging character.
Humurous, youthful, intellectual and reasonable.

Awesome teacher! incredibly knowledgable about the subject and he actually makes learning this stuff really interesting.Very funny teacher too so it makes the class a blast. Devoted to his students, and always available for help. He won't do it for you but he explains clearly what you need to do, which is the best way to help students!!
